sectors.name: Agriculture
sectors.notes: Agriculture is a Sharia-compliant sector as it involves the production and sale of halal (permissible) food products. Islamic financing models such as murabahah and salam can be used to support agricultural activities.

sectors.name: Automotive
sectors.notes: The automotive sector is generally considered Sharia-compliant as it involves the manufacture and sale of vehicles. However, investors should ensure that the companies they invest in do not have any haram (forbidden) activities such as producing vehicles for military or other non-permissible purposes.

sectors.name: Aeronautics
sectors.notes: The aeronautics sector is generally considered Sharia-compliant as it involves the manufacture and sale of aircraft. However, investors should ensure that the companies they invest in do not have any haram activities such as producing aircraft for military or other non-permissible purposes.

sectors.name: Textiles
sectors.notes: The textiles sector is generally considered Sharia-compliant as it involves the production and sale of clothing and other textile products. Islamic financing models such as murabahah and salam can be used to support textile activities.

sectors.name: Agri-food
sectors.notes: The agri-food sector is generally considered Sharia-compliant as it involves the production and sale of halal food products. Islamic financing models such as murabahah and salam can be used to support agri-food activities.
